document_data.caption: A map of Lapaliiya showing the location of Dungar.
document_data.name: Dungar
document_data.mainbody: '''Dungar''' was a small town in [[Lapaliiya]] in [[southwest Faerûn]] in the mid–14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Geography: The town stood among rolling hills on the trade route between the coastal cities of [[Lapaliiya]] and the [[Talath Pass]] to [[Halruaa]].
document_data.Government & Religion:
Around [[1373 DR]], the town was ruled by members of a local family who claimed descent from the famous bandit lord [[Felingar]].

The civic deity of Dungar was [[Chauntea]].
document_data.Economy: It was a farming town focused on growing olives and producing [[wine]], with many olive groves and vineyards surrounding the community.
document_data.Population: It had a population of 931 people, most of them farmers.
document_data.Legends: Felingar's crypt was buried somewhere under the hills around Dungar. It was said to hide Felingar's stolen fortune, namely the dowry of a chansreena (princess) of [[Ormpur]].
